title: Fact Check-Photo does not show truckers praying in 2022 | Reuters
htmlTitle: Fact Check-Photo does not show truckers praying in 2022 | Reuters
snippet: Feb 22, 2022 ... A widely shared image on social media showing a group of men ... truckers praying amid the protests against COVID-19 restrictions in Canada.
htmlSnippet: Feb 22, 2022 ... A widely shared image on social media showing a group of men ... truckers praying amid the protests against COVID-19 restrictions in Canada.

metatags.twitter:creator: @Reuters
metatags.og:description: A widely shared image on social media showing a group of men kneeling in a circle has been circulating since at least March 2020. Some online, however, have miscaptioned the image as if it showed truckers praying amid the protests against COVID-19 restrictions in Canada.

metatags.twitter:title: Busting coronavirus myths
metatags.og:title: Busting coronavirus myths
metatags.og:description: Rumours, myths and misinformation about Covid-19 have spread as quickly as the disease itself. AFP Factcheck has been debunking disinformation as it emerges along with new cases across the world.  Here is a list of our 1395 fact-checks in English so far, starting with the most recent:  (AFP Graphics) 1395. Covid-19 vaccines not linked to Sudden Arrhythmic Death Syndromes Social media posts claim "Sudden Adult Death Syndrome" is a new condition linked to the Covid-19 vaccine, proving that Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) is also a vaccine side effect.
metatags.twitter:creator: @afpfactuel

metatags.twitter:title: Injunction granted to prevent protesters from blocking Ambassador Bridge
metatags.author: Nicole Thompson in Toronto and Maan Alhmidi in Windsor, Ont.
metatags.og:title: Injunction granted to prevent protesters from blocking Ambassador Bridge
metatags.og:description: Protesters blocking one of Canada's busiest border crossings were dealt a one-two punch Friday, as a court granted an injunction banning their blockade and Ontario's premier declared a state of emergency that would subject them to major fines.
